basic.floral_language:
Pachyphytum oviferum 
Floriography: pure, grand, beautiful
Has a beautiful shape with thick fleshy and gray-green to blue-green leaves in an oval shape and arranged in a rosette, leaf surface has thick white powder. In a cool season with adequate light, leaves turn slightly red. Grows slowly, suitable for combinations with other potted succulents.
Likes adequate sunlight, no apparent dormant period. Flowers are purple to red.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, purple red to red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray green to blue green, with a great diurnal temperature range, with adequate sunlight slightly turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
